sources.data_found: 2022/2023 Degree Completion Data used for enrollment estimates.
Greene cluster specs: 73 nodes w/ 4 RTX8000, 10 nodes w/ 4 V100.
BigPurple: 157 nodes total, 87 GPU nodes (376 GPUs total), mix of V100 and A100.
Torch spec sheet: H200 GPU nodes=29 (232 GPUs); L40S GPU nodes=68 (272 GPUs).
TOP500 system page for 'Greene-H100' lists 9,360 CPU cores.
Greene HPC hardware summary (RTX8000 and V100 counts).

student_data.notes: Figures are estimates based on aggregated findings. Undergrad estimate (2,736) derived from 2022 degree completions (684 * 4 years) covering both Courant and Tandon. Grad count (956) based on 2023 MS degree awards. PhD count (225) estimated from doctoral completions (41/yr * 5.5 years).

gpu_resources.notes: Aggregated GPU resources from multiple NYU clusters (Greene, Torch, BigPurple, Skynet). H100 count (780) is estimated based on TOP500 'Greene-H100' system core counts (9,360 cores) assuming standard HGX 4-GPU nodes. H200 (232) and L40S (272) counts come from the new 'Torch' cluster spec sheet. V100 counts aggregate the Greene general partition (76+), Skynet (192), and BigPurple (approx 376 mixed). A100s are split between Medical/Radiology (Condo/BigPurple) and general research.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. GPU counts reflect a massive recent expansion (Torch cluster) alongside legacy systems (Greene, BigPurple). Student data relies on completion-based estimation proxies as direct 2024 enrollment data was unavailable.
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPU resources appear to be locally owned and operated by NYU. Student data is present and appears reasonable.
